intro: Pultenaea juniperina var. mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a shrub that typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in dry or semi-arid environments. The plant produces bright yellow flowers in late winter to early spring, which are characteristic of the genus Pultenaea. Its leaves are narrow and linear, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The variety mucronata is distinguished by its short, blunt leaf tips and compact growth habit.
